title: iSnap - Introductory Programming
creator: Price, Thomas
description:
"iSnap logs all student actions to a remote database, including any interactions with the user interface and coding
area. It also logs complete snapshots of students’ code after each edit, allowing for complete replay of a student’s
actions within the environment. Each entry in iSnap’s logs
consists of an event type (e.g. “block grabbed”, “project exported”), any associated data (e.g. an ID for the grabbed
block) and an updated snapshot of the student’s code (if
changed). While this data could have many uses, we use it
specifically to automatically generate contextual hints"
